data.title: Don't tell your friends!
data.text:
I enjoy a good pork vermicelli noodle bowl and this one was really good.  Tasty grilled pork with a bit of smoke flavor.   I usually also order Vietnamese iced coffee (Ca  phe sua da)- the coffee is made at the table in a small French press into a glass of sweetened condensed milk.  Authentic compared to the other "Pho" place in town, glad I found it!   

This is a good local hole in the wall place for lunch or dinner, but its not a big place- so don't tell your friends so there's a seat for me!

data.title: Small, but nice
data.text: just found this little treasure.  It is on High St where the Baskin Robbins used to be.  It is small, but that is one of the things i like about it.  If you have never had Vietnamese food, i suggest you give it a try!  Pictures of the menu items are on the wall.  The pho soup is of course the best!

data.title: Fast and good
data.text:
We had the fried rice and chic beef and shrimp noodles.  Everything was very good . Service was fast and friendly

Yes I do recommend

data.title: Pho
data.text: It was okay if you like noodle soup.  They have a strange take on egg Foo Yong.  The serving is 2 giant omelets.  Not what I had expected.

data.title: Expecting more
data.text:
This is definitely a hole in the wall.  We arrived just after dark on a Saturday night and weren't quite sure it was open as the sign was off, there was only 1 car in the lot, and there were few lights on in the restaurant.  We went in and the owner was in back somewhere and when she came out, she turned on the lights and told us to sit anywhere.  The 1st booth we chose was covered in something sticky so we moved down a couple of booths.  My wife still wiped this one off.  

The owner came and got our drink orders.  We both got iced jasmine tea.  We are not from Longview and not used to it but the city water is nasty and made the ice taste like dirt.  We ordered the pork and shrimp spring rolls, chicken soup (pho), and beef pho.  Next time, we will order the shrimp and leave off the pork.  The pork in the spring rolls resembles sliced deli meat of some sort.  It was okay for me but my wife wouldn't eat it.  The pho came out nice and hot.  There wasn't much meat in either one but the flavor was good.  

Overall, prices were decent, food was okay, and service was decent.  We talked with the owner some about Vietnam and that was enjoyable.  There were some pretty interesting items on the menu that we would like to try but there is another Vietnamese restaurant in town and I believe we would go there again before coming back to this one.

data.title: Authentic food where you're treated like family
data.text: The place is  nothing fancy but it is very clean.  The food is great.  The menu is varied and authentic.  I love the Vietnamese Spring Rolls with peanut dipping sauce, the Pho, and the lemongrass chicken with coconut milk.  But I think what I love most is the way I am treated here - not just as a customer but as a returning friend or family member.  The owner is such a sweet lady who will remember and welcome you back time and time again.  It's great to have a non-chain restaurant with such consistently great food.  We try to go at least once a week.

data.title: Delicious and authentic
data.text: I had BBQ for lunch ( this is Texas after all!) so I was looking for something a little lighter for dinner. I was greeted by a pleasant smile when I came in the door I got the spring tools with peanut sauce and the special Pho soup which has flank steak, beef brisket and meatballs. The food was fresh and delicious. It was just the right amount that left me satisfied but not stuffed. They are open Monday through Saturday from 11 am to 8pm. You should give this place a try if you are ready for something fresh and different.

data.title: Interesting Place with Good Food
data.text: Place serves excellent Vietnamese food, service is good but different, highly recommended. Their French Coffee is a must.

data.title: Great food and the lady will even show you how to eat it right.
data.text: Everything there is good. Just order any of the dished that look good and the lady will show you how to mix things together to get what you want as far as spicy or sweet. Like dinner lessons for Vietnamese eating. Great experience.

data.title: best pho and sweetest smile in longview
data.text: the pho here is delicious. make sure you add the sauces, herbs, sprouts, and lime! the food is superb. there is a nice variety to choose from. we have had many dishes and were never disappointed. the service is wonderful and always with such a genuine smile. eat-in or take-out is great. we love this place!!!

data.title: Best, anywhere!
data.text: My husband and I love, love, love this place.  The Pho is, not surprisingly superb; but try the noodle dishes also.  The Spring Rolls with Ginger-Peanut sauce is the best I've had this side of the Pacific Rim.  You could very likely close your eyes and point to anything on the menu, and get a winner.

data.title: Unexpected treasure in Longview.
data.text: I love carry out from Pho- Service is adequate, atmosphere hole in wall but food is above average.   When placing Pho in the context of Longview TX,  I think it is one of the best places to eat in Longview. Try 13a,13 or 7a. I love #1 - and beef salad for appetizers.  The basil and lettuce and mint that wraps around the egg roll is fabulous.  The mealsvrange in price from 8 to 12 dollars -I think Pho is a good value and fresh! In my top  6 best of Longview places to eat in Longview.

data.title: Nice Mom & Pop
data.text: This is a small, friendly family run restaurant.  The food is always good but nothing really outstanding.  Except for their chicken soup!  It's our family's go to comfort food for cold days (both health & temperature wise).

data.title: Pho-riffic!
data.text: This place is a real surprise and such a departure from typical east Texas restaurants. If you love little hole in the wall ethnic restaurants where the owners are "from there" and are working in the back to put their love, sweat and tears in the food, this is your kind of place. The food is sublime and the couple who own the place are darling. It's easy to see they really care about the food and their customers. Do your palate a favor and go Pho! If you're going for atmosphere, keep driving another 2 hours to Dallas. This is east Texas after all.

data.title: good food, variable attitude
data.text: we  either dine in or take out from this restaurant when visiting longview.  the food is  always fresh and tasty.  the lemon grass chicken and bun dishes are outstanding.  the atmosphere is basic diner -- generally clean, utilitarian tables and chairs.  the woman who runs the place can be moody.  i had heard from friends that she has snapped at them, but hadn't had any issues with her until this last visit.  a request for an extra container of sauce was met with an answer of " you have enough sauce in the bag" and then she huffed off into the kitchen.  in the past, she has been at least civil to deal with, sometimes even pleasant. i guess she's overworked.  the food is great and the prices are reasonable, but just don't take it personally if she is curt instead of courteous.

data.title: It is one of my favorites
data.text: This is a converted ice cream shop. You shouldn't come for the atmosphere, but if you are looking for a wonderful comfort style meal, you must come here. The beef stew is my favorite, with any of the noodle soups a very close second. My wife always liked the grilled pork on rice. If you are looking for something besides mexican in Longview, you'll find this a nice change of pace.

data.title: Authentic fresh food
data.text: Vegetarians welcome here!  Vegans too.  Rarity in our community.  Fresh sprouts and herbs.  Tofu dishes.   High marks from me.  For health conscious eaters a must.  Family run.   Rosie is a delight.

data.title: A good change
data.text: This is a little treasure of Longview. Been there a few times and has always been good. Highly recommend you give it a try

data.title: how did this make it on the list?!
data.text: Poor service and the food was nearly as bad. It was over priced for what it was! Just came back from living in Vietnam and this wasn't even comparable. The cook/cashier would come between the kitchen and the cash register so oour order was all messed up. took 30 min. to recieve it as we watched 5 orders agter us be served
